snippet: Overshadowed by the conflicts in Iraq and Syria, the rebel group’s stunning advance on Sana on Sept. 21 drew little notice.
abstract: Houthis ascendance in Yemen has brought trepidation, but also relief among those who have welcomed the rebels’ populist promises or have simply tired of the government’s failures; overshadowed by conflicts in Iraq and Syria, Houthis’ lightning advance on capital Sana drew little notice even as it seemed to fundamentally reshape Yemen’s politics.

byline.original: By SHUAIB ALMOSAWA and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Saeed Al-Batati contributed reporting from Al Mukalla, Yemen.

lead_paragraph: Overshadowed by the conflicts in Iraq and Syria, the rebel group’s stunning advance on Sana on Sept. 21 drew little notice.

headline.main: Whirlwind Ascent of Houthi Rebels in Yemen Brings Relief and Trepidation
headline.print_headline: Whirlwind Ascent of Houthi Rebels in Yemen Brings Relief and Trepidation

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
